types.name: Query
types.description: Root query type

fields.name: viewer
fields.description: The viewer of this request

fields.name: dataKeyOptions
fields.description: Retrieves the list of data key options for a stock portfolio header. All filters are OR'ed.

fields.name: stockPortfolios
fields.description: Gets a paginated list of stock portfolios based on filters

args.name: first
args.description: A limit of how many items to grab after the `after` cursor

args.name: last
args.description:
A limit of how many items to grab before the end bound of the paginated search (the
smaller of `before` or `first`)

args.name: before
args.description: A cursor to specify before which item a search should occur

args.name: after
args.description: A cursor to specify after which item a search should occur

types.name: Viewer
types.description: The viewer of this request

fields.name: id
fields.description: The viewer's id

fields.name: email
fields.description: The viewer's email

fields.name: emailVerified
fields.description: Whether this viewer verified their email address

fields.name: username
fields.description: The viewer's username

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: DataKey
types.description: The dataKey property of a stock portfolio header, that determines what data is pulled

types.name: DataKey_Provider
types.description: The provider for the data provided by the data key

enumValues.name: IEX_CLOUD
enumValues.description: IEX Cloud (see `https://iexcloud.io/`)

types.name: DataKeyOption
types.description: A single data key option that can be selected for a stock portfolio header

fields.name: name
fields.description: A more normal name. This can be shown to users.

fields.name: dataKey
fields.description: A unique data key for fetching stock portfolio data

fields.name: description
fields.description: A description of the data that is fetched with this data key

fields.name: provider
fields.description: The name of the provider

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: StockPortfolioConnection
types.description: The stock portfolio connection, from which pagination and resource info can be gotten

fields.name: edges
fields.description: Holds cursor and resource information

fields.name: nodes
fields.description: Convenience property to avoid nesting

fields.name: pageInfo
fields.description: Pagination info, on whether there is more data

types.name: StockPortfolioEdge
types.description: Connection edges, which hold cursor and resource information

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: Cursor for pagination

fields.name: node
fields.description: The actual stock portfolio data

types.name: StockPortfolio
types.description: StockPortfolio entity. This is what gets shown on the data grid

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the stock portfolio

fields.name: user
fields.description: The user that this stock portfolio belongs to. Also the creator

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name, the user has given to this stock portfolio

fields.name: headers
fields.description: The headers (configs) for this data grid, including how data is resolved

fields.name: tickers
fields.description: The tickers that are the rows for this data grid

fields.name: data
fields.description: The data that gets resolved based on headers and tickers

types.name: User
types.description: Basic user of the application

fields.name: id
fields.description: The id of the user

fields.name: email
fields.description: The user's email

fields.name: emailVerified
fields.description: Whether the user verified their email address

fields.name: username
fields.description: The user's username

types.name: EmailAddress
types.description:
A field whose value conforms to the standard internet email address format as
specified in RFC822: https://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc822/.

types.name: StockPortfolioHeader
types.description: A column configuration for the stock portfolio on the data grid

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name displayed for this column header

fields.name: dataKey
fields.description: The dataKey, which determines how values in this column are resolved

fields.name: width
fields.description: The configured width of this column

fields.name: frozen
fields.description: Whether this column could be moved

fields.name: resizable
fields.description: Whether this column could be resized

types.name: JSON
types.description: The `JSON` scalar type represents JSON values as specified by [ECMA-404](http://www.ecma-international.org/publications/files/ECMA-ST/ECMA-404.pdf).

types.name: PageInfo
types.description: Pagination info, to show if other pages exist

fields.name: hasNextPage
fields.description: Pagination info, whether there is more data going forward

fields.name: hasPreviousPage
fields.description: Pagination info, whether there is more data going backward

fields.name: count
fields.description: Total count of results across all pages

fields.name: startCursor
fields.description: The cursor for the first item in this page

fields.name: endCursor
fields.description: The cursor for the last item in this page

types.description: Root mutation type

fields.name: viewer
fields.description: The viewer of this request

fields.name: loginLocalUser
fields.description: Logins in the user, and returns an expiring access token

fields.name: refreshAccessToken
fields.description: Refreshes the currently logged-in user's access token

fields.name: registerLocalUser
fields.description: Performs local authentication (custom username + password)

fields.name: resendVerifyEmail
fields.description: Resends the account verification email to the logged-in user

fields.name: createStockPortfolio
fields.description: Creates an empty stock portfolio

fields.name: updateStockPortfolio
fields.description: Updates a stock portfolio

fields.name: deleteStockPortfolio
fields.description: Deletes a stock portfolio

inputFields.name: userIdentifier
inputFields.description: The email or username (either) of the user

inputFields.name: password
inputFields.description: The user's decrypted password

types.name: TokenPayload
types.description: The response from a successful login or token refresh request

fields.name: token
fields.description: JSON web token to authenticate API requests

fields.name: refreshToken
fields.description: JSON web token to refresh the token

inputFields.name: refreshToken
inputFields.description: The refresh token, that is used to refresh the access token

inputFields.name: email
inputFields.description: (Unique) The user's email

inputFields.name: password
inputFields.description: The user's decrypted password

inputFields.name: username
inputFields.description: (Unique) The user's username

types.name: UserPassword
types.description: The plain-text password of a user to be hashed

types.name: RegisterLocalUserPayload
types.description: The response object from a local register user request

fields.name: success
fields.description: Whether the registration successfully created a user or not

fields.name: error
fields.description: An error will be described if success is false

fields.name: user
fields.description: The user object

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: (Unique) The name of this stock portfolio.

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: The ID of the stock portfolio to update

inputFields.name: headers
inputFields.description: Headers for this data grid, including how data is resolved

inputFields.name: tickers
inputFields.description: The tickers that are the rows for this data grid

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: Id of the stock portfolio to delete

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: The id of the user

inputFields.name: email
inputFields.description: The user's email

inputFields.name: emailVerified
inputFields.description: Whether the user verified their email address

inputFields.name: username
inputFields.description: The user's encoded password

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: BigInt
types.description: The `BigInt` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values.

types.name: ConnectionInput
types.description: Search items based on a connection property

inputFields.name: someOf
inputFields.description: An array of IDs. Returns items such that this property contains some of specified IDs

inputFields.name: allOf
inputFields.description: An array of IDs. Returns items such that this property contains all of specified IDs

inputFields.name: size
inputFields.description: Returns items such that this property has this number of values

inputFields.name: empty
inputFields.description: Returns items based on whether or not this property is empty

types.name: DateTime
types.description: Use JavaScript Date object for date/time fields.

types.name: DateTimeInput
types.description: Search items based on date-time property

inputFields.name: milliseconds
inputFields.description: Milliseconds of the second (can be from 0-999)

inputFields.name: seconds
inputFields.description: Seconds of the minute (can be 0-59)

inputFields.name: minutes
inputFields.description: Minutes of the hour (can be 0-59)

inputFields.name: hours
inputFields.description: Hours of the day (can be 0-23)

inputFields.name: day
inputFields.description: Date: DD in (MM/DD/YYYY), indexed from 1

inputFields.name: month
inputFields.description: Date: MM in (MM/DD/YYYY), indexed from 1

inputFields.name: year
inputFields.description: Date: YYYY in (MM/DD/YYYY), indexed from 1

types.name: GUID
types.description: A field whose value is a generic Globally Unique Identifier: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universally_unique_identifier.

types.name: Hexadecimal
types.description: A field whose value is a hexadecimal: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hexadecimal.

types.name: HexColorCode
types.description: A field whose value is a hex color code: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_colors.

types.name: HSL
types.description: A field whose value is a CSS HSL color: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value#hsl()_and_hsla().

types.name: HSLA
types.description: A field whose value is a CSS HSLA color: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value#hsl()_and_hsla().

types.name: IBAN
types.description:
A field whose value is an International Bank Account Number (IBAN):
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Bank_Account_Number.

types.name: IPv4
types.description: A field whose value is a IPv4 address: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IPv4.

types.name: IPv6
types.description: A field whose value is a IPv6 address: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IPv6.

types.name: ISBN
types.description: A field whose value is a ISBN-10 or ISBN-13 number: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number.

types.name: JSONObject
types.description: The `JSONObject` scalar type represents JSON objects as specified by [ECMA-404](http://www.ecma-international.org/publications/files/ECMA-ST/ECMA-404.pdf).

types.name: Long
types.description: The `BigInt` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values.

types.name: MAC
types.description: A field whose value is a IEEE 802 48-bit MAC address: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MAC_address.

types.name: NegativeFloat
types.description: Floats that will have a value less than 0.

types.name: NegativeInt
types.description: Integers that will have a value less than 0.

types.name: NonNegativeFloat
types.description: Floats that will have a value of 0 or more.

types.name: NonNegativeInt
types.description: Integers that will have a value of 0 or more.

types.name: NonPositiveFloat
types.description: Floats that will have a value of 0 or less.

types.name: NonPositiveInt
types.description: Integers that will have a value of 0 or less.

types.name: PhoneNumber
types.description:
A field whose value conforms to the standard E.164 format as specified in:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/E.164. Basically this is +17895551234.

types.name: Port
types.description:
A field whose value is a valid TCP port within the range of 0 to 65535:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transmission_Control_Protocol#TCP_ports

types.name: PositiveFloat
types.description: Floats that will have a value greater than 0.

types.name: PositiveInt
types.description: Integers that will have a value greater than 0.

types.name: PostalCode
types.description:
A field whose value conforms to the standard postal code formats for United
States, United Kingdom, Germany, Canada, France, Italy, Australia, Netherlands,
Spain, Denmark, Sweden, Belgium, India, Austria, Portugal, Switzerland or Luxembourg.

types.name: RGB
types.description: A field whose value is a CSS RGB color: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value#rgb()_and_rgba().

types.name: RGBA
types.description: A field whose value is a CSS RGBA color: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color_value#rgb()_and_rgba().

types.name: UnsignedFloat
types.description: Floats that will have a value of 0 or more.

types.name: UnsignedInt
types.description: Integers that will have a value of 0 or more.

types.name: URL
types.description: A field whose value conforms to the standard URL format as specified in RFC3986: https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3986.txt.

types.name: USCurrency
types.description: A currency string, such as $21.25

types.name: VariableDateTimeInput
types.description: Search items based on a range, or fuzzy date

inputFields.name: before
inputFields.description: Returns items such that this property comes before the specified date-time

inputFields.name: after
inputFields.description: Returns items such that this property comes after the specified date-time

inputFields.name: equal
inputFields.description: Returns items such that this property's date-time contains exactly the fields as specifed

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax (as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).
